info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 8:03PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A NARROW BAND OF SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SCHOHARIE AND WESTERN ALBANY COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A narrow band of moderate to briefly heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 800 PM EDT, an area of heavy snow was over Richmondville, or near Cobleskill moving east at 30 MPH. THIS AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Richmondville around 805 PM EDT. Cobleskill around 815 PM EDT. Breakabeen around 825 PM EDT. Middleburgh around 830 PM EDT. Livingstonville around 840 PM EDT. Westerlo around 900 PM EDT. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 21. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this area of moderate to briefly heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
